intro: Kinetostigma nanum, commonly known as the dwarf kinetostigma, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
